Player History
Drafted in 5th round, 84th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1971...
Injured on 6/5/1972 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 5/10/1975 with a Inflamed Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 7 weeks...
Traded from Minnesota to San Francisco on 7/14/1977 (Going to SF: P D. Lewallyn, P M. Fidrych, SS R. Washington, LF L. Fritz, LF M. Rivers. Going to MIN: 1B B. Robertson)...
Injured on 8/16/1978 with a Bruised Heel, out for 2 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1979, off John Lamb (PHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/8/1979, off Dennis Eckersley (STL)...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1979, hitting .458 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Third Base in 1979...
Won Gold Glove Award at Third Base in 1980...
Won Gold Glove Award at Third Base in 1981...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Chicago (N) on 5/1/1982...
Injured on 7/21/1982 with a Sore Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
